name: chunk of beef
description: Fresh meat from a cow. You could eat it raw, but cooking it is better.
//: Nutrition information found here https://fdc.nal.usda.gov/fdc-app.html#/food-details/174032/nutrients Values founded by multiplying values taken at 100 grams by 2.96 grams to get the correct numbers for a serving at 296 grams.

name: scrap of beef
description: This is a tiny scrap of edible beef.  It's not much, but it'll do in a pinch.

name: cooked beef
description: This is a chunk of freshly cooked beef.  It's filling and nutritious, but unseasoned and a bit bland.

name: smoked beef
description: Tasty beef that has been heavily smoked for preservation.  It could be further smoked to dehydrate it completely.

name: pickled beef
description: This is a serving of crisply brined and canned beef.  Tasty and nutritious.

name: dehydrated beef
description: Dehydrated beef flakes.  With proper storage, this dried food will remain edible for an incredibly long time.

name: rehydrated beef
description: Reconstituted beef, which are much more enjoyable to eat now that they have been rehydrated.
